item.title: Ford-Fulkerson
item.description: Ford-Fulkerson Continually add [[Augmenting Path]]s to increase the maximum flow from the [[Flow Networks#Source]] to the [[Flow Networks#Sink]]. Find a path Compute bottleneck capacity Augment path Upon each iteration, we are guaranteed to increase max flow at least one.

item.title: Max-Flow Min-Cut Theorem
item.description: Max-Flow Min-Cut Theorem In a flow network, the maximum amount of flow passing from the source to the sink (aka the [[Max Flow Rate]]) is equal to the total capacities of the outgoing edges in the [[Min Cut]].

item.title: Min Cut
item.description: Min Cut The minimum sum of weights of edges that when removed, makes a [[Cut]] between $s$ and $t$ .
